SEARCH
Package com.example.atlasevents.data

Class OrganiserWaitlistListener

java.lang.Object
com.example.atlasevents.data.OrganiserWaitlistListener
public class OrganiserWaitlistListener extends Object
Listens for real-time changes to event waitlists and notifies organizers. Monitors additions and removals from event waitlists and creates notifications for the event organizer when changes occur.

This class provides organizers with immediate feedback when users join or leave their event waitlists, enabling timely management of event attendance.

See Also:

  • FirebaseFirestore
  • ListenerRegistration

  • Constructor Details

    • OrganiserWaitlistListener

      public OrganiserWaitlistListener(@NonNull String eventId, @NonNull String organizerEmail)
      Constructs a new waitlist listener for the specified event and organizer.
      Parameters:
      eventId - The unique identifier of the event to monitor
      organizerEmail - The email address of the event organizer to notify
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if eventId or organizerEmail is null
      See Also:
      • start()
      • stop()

  • Method Details

    • start

      public void start()
      Starts listening for waitlist changes on the specified event. Attaches a Firestore snapshot listener to the event's waitlist collection. Creates notifications for the organizer when entrants are added or removed.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if Firestore operations fail
      See Also:
      • stop()
      • createNotificationForOrganizer(String, String, DocumentSnapshot)

    • stop

      public void stop()
      Stops listening for waitlist changes and cleans up resources. Removes the Firestore snapshot listener.
      See Also:
      • start()
